title: World Building Strategy Worksheet
description: Establishes the foundational strategic decisions for the worldbuilding project: scope, career plans, primary medium, exposition strategy, and analogue principles. This worksheet is completed once at the start and revisited periodically.
source_chapter: V1 Ch1 -- Why Build A World?

scope.description: How many worlds will you build? One world for one story, one world for many stories, many separate worlds, or a hybrid approach

career_length.description: How long do you plan to use this world? Short-term (1-2 projects), long-term (3-10 projects), or lifer (career-spanning)

primary_medium.description: The primary medium through which this world will be experienced

secondary_media.description: Any additional media planned for this world

stories_planned.description: How many stories are planned for this world

genre.description: The primary genre of the world

technology_level.description: Brief description of the world's technology level (e.g., medieval, industrial, space-faring)

exposition_strategy.description: Primary strategy for revealing worldbuilding to the audience

exposition_notes.description: Detailed notes on how worldbuilding will be revealed through the chosen strategy

analogue_philosophy.description: Your approach to using Earth analogues: how aggressively will you remix real-world sources? Will you follow the Rule of Three consistently?

naming_philosophy.description: Your approach to naming invented things: when will you use known terms vs. invented names? How will you handle mental inertia?

depth_philosophy.description: How deep will you go? Which areas will receive maximum detail vs. moderate vs. minimal?

influences.description: Key creative influences (authors, mythologies, games, films) that will shape this world

audience.description: Who is the target audience? Age range, genre expectations, familiarity with the genre

x-cross-references.worldbuilding-goals: This strategy worksheet is complemented by the Worldbuilding Goals Worksheet which defines specific creation priorities
x-cross-references.file-organization: The File Organization Template implements the storage strategy implied by these decisions
